name: Go rank (EGF)
description:
In the game of Go players have a rank like here in Codewars. There are kyu levels going up to 1 kyu and then dan levels starting at 1 dan going up to 9 dan (or 7 dan). In order to track a person's go rank, the European Go Federation (EGF) has implemented an ELO-like system, where each rank corresponds to a rating. (see also https://www.europeangodatabase.eu/EGD/EGF_rating_system.php)

They set a level of 20 kyu at a rating of 100. A rank difference of 1 is equal to a rating difference of 100. So, 19 kyu equals 200, 18 kyu equals 300, ... 1 kyu equals 2000, 1 dan equals 2100, ...

Negative ratings exist down to a value of -900, where they are capped. (The rating is capped, the rank does not need a capping.)

If your rating is somewhere in-between, you round it towards the nearest multiple of 100 to find out your rank, e.g. a rating of 270 equals a rank of 18 kyu. A rating ending exactly on 50 will always be rounded up, e.g. a rating of 2050 equals a rank of 1 dan.

Your task is to write a function which converts the rating of a player to a rank. Inputs will always be a number (negative and floating point possible). The return value should be a string representing the rank in the format number+rank type shortened, e.g. 3 kyu = "3k". See test cases for more examples.

Happy coding.
